document_title: Lung abscess: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
According to Prof. Dr. Ngo Quy Chau, there are many ways to classify, specifically:
1. Based on the progression of the disease
Acute lung abscess: When the progression of the disease lasts less than 4 - 6 weeks; Chronic lung abscess: When the progression of the disease lasts more than 6 weeks.
2. Based on the patient's constitution
Primary abscess: Is an infection of the lung parenchyma without any previous damage or disease; Secondary abscess: Is an infection of the lung parenchyma that occurs on existing lesions such as tuberculous cavities, bronchiectasis, or metastatic foci due to sepsis...
Stages of the disease
